inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: clinical and CT or MRI imaging demonstrating ventricular dilation, confirmed by an established protocol of continuous CSF drainage via spinal catheter

inclusion.criterion: Patients who are found to be eligible for VP shunt insertion on the basis of improvement in cognition/psychomotor speed, gait, or urinary continence
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: improvement in cognition/psychomotor speed, gait, or urinary continence

exclusion.criterion: Known peripheral gland failure (primary hypogonadism, primary adrenal insufficiency, primary hypothyroidism)
exclusion.label: unknown
triggers
exclusion.evidence: past medical history is only significant for acromegaly due to pituitary adenoma and the recent surgery

notes: The patient has a known case of Acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago. He takes only vitamin D and multivitamins after his surgery.
